intro: Anaphalis pterocaulon, commonly known as the silverleaf tickseed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silvery, woolly leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Anaphalis pterocaulon is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes.
